revised_title: Acoustic Streaming in Liquids: The Role of Sound Absorption
tldr: This article discusses the phenomenon of acoustic streaming in liquids and the role of sound absorption in determining the velocity of streaming. The authors argue that the streaming velocity is directly dependent on the coefficient of sound absorption, rather than the second coefficient of viscosity. They present a method for determining the sound-absorption coefficient of a liquid from measurements of the velocity of streaming and provide some typical results.
